H0.text: Seafloor spreading creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H1.text: Sedimentation creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H2.text: Crust spreading creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H3.text: Continental drift creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

A4.text: At the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, material from the upper mantle rises through the faults between oceanic plates to form new crust as the plates move away from each other.

A5.text: In locations where two plates move apart, at mid-ocean ridges, new seafloor is continually formed during seafloor spreading.
